uk.ac.man.cs.mig.util.graph.export

Interface ExportFormat

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRasterFormat, AbstractVectorFormat, DotExportFormat, JPEGExportFormat, PNGExportFormat, SVGExportFormat

    public interface ExportFormat
    User: matthewhorridge
    The Univeristy Of Manchester
    Medical Informatics Group
    Date: Feb 20, 2004

    matthew.horridge@cs.man.ac.uk
    www.cs.man.ac.uk/~horridgm

    • Method Detail

      • getFormatName

        String getFormatName()
        Gets the name of the export format. This is typically displayed in the user interface when selecting an export format.
        Returns:
        The name of the export format (e.g. Scalable Vector Graphics)

      • getFormatFileExtension

        String getFormatFileExtension()
        Gets the file extension for the export type.
        Returns:
        The export type file extensions (e.g. svg)

      • getFormatDescription

        String getFormatDescription()
        Gets a description of the export type, which is typically displayed in the user interface when selecting an export format.
        Returns:
        A description of the export type.

      • export

        void export(Controller controller,
            OutputStream os)
        Exports the graphics to the specified file.
        Parameters:
        controller - The controller, which allows access to the GraphView etc.
        os - The OutputStream that the exported format should be written to.

      • isRasterFormat

        boolean isRasterFormat()
        Determines if the export is a raster format or not.
        Returns:
        true if the image is a raster format such as png, jpeg, or false if the image is not a raster format e.g. eps, svg.

      • supportsAntialiasing

        boolean supportsAntialiasing()
        Determine whether or not the format supports antialiasing.
        Returns:
        true if the export format does support antialiasing, or false if the export format does not support antialiasing.

      • setAntialiased

        void setAntialiased(boolean b)
        If the export is a raster format it may support antialiasing. This method can be used to specifiy whether anti alisaing should be used or not.
        Parameters:
        b - true if antialiasing should be used, or false if antialiasing should not be used.

      • getAntialiased

        boolean getAntialiased()
        If the export supports antialiasing, this method ,ay be used to determine whether antialiasing will be applied.
        Returns:
        true if antialiasing is applied, false if antialiasing is not applied.

      • supportsScaledOutput

        boolean supportsScaledOutput()
        Determines whether or not the export format supports the notion of scaling or not. Raster formats such as png jpeg etc. typically can be scaled - vector formats such as eps and svg can be rescaled without loss in quality, and therefore do not typically support the notion of a fixed export scale.
        Returns:
        true if the export format supports the notion of scaling, false if the export format does not support scaling, or the scaling option does not make sense.

      • setScale

        void setScale(double percentage)
        If the export format supports the notion of outputting to a fixed scale, then this method may be used to set the scale of the export.
        Parameters:
        percentage - The percentage of original size that the export should be scaled to. 100.0 equates to one hundred percent i.e. original size.

      • getScale

        double getScale()
        If the export format supports scaling, this method can be used to obtain the scaling applied to the export.
        Returns:
        The scaling applied to the export. 100.0 is equivalent to 100 percent.
